channel.title: Linux Ubuntu VPS - Alot of problems
channel.description:
Hello,
I have a problem with my Linux Ubuntu VPS, when ever I type the run command for my .sh my server does not go online. I also cant check if it is running! Because I am on putty.
Anyone that can help?
To what should my run.bat change?
code: [code]
@echo off java -Xmx500m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.08-ga-bin.jar server pause [/code]
Thanks :)

item.title: Linux Ubuntu VPS - Alot of problems
item.dc:creator: @youridudock youridudock
item.description:
@youridudock wrote:

So I contacted the VPS company about a refund but they said that they cannot refund.
I decided instead of trying to fix this and wasting vps days I went and installed Wine and I am now hosting it using Wine.

I know Wine is a bad choose, but I had to.

Mod can close this topic.

Read full topic
item.source: Linux Ubuntu VPS - Alot of problems

item.title: Linux Ubuntu VPS - Alot of problems
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

[quote=“youridudock, post:23, topic:478559”][quote author=Niall link=topic=596786.msg4202526#msg4202526 date=1358432046]
the real question to ask is why the hell you’re making a shell script for a single line command
[/quote]

Because I have no clue what I am doing, anyways I somehow lost internet on the Vps so I cant do anything until they fix it

-.-[/quote]

Basically all your shell script is doing is executing that one command, as if you typed it directly in the terminal. You don’t need a script because you could just manually type in the command, but hey, I don’t know how you like to do things.

Read full topic

item.title: Linux Ubuntu VPS - Alot of problems
item.dc:creator: @youridudock youridudock
item.description:
@youridudock wrote:

[quote=“ziplock, post:20, topic:478559”]Well you could try:

#!/bin/bash
javac -cp . *.java

If that doesn’t work then I recommend just creating a Hello World program on your Desktop and seeing if it will compile using the terminal.

cd Desktop javac *.java [/quote]

Yep that worked and it also worked in the server folder. It still gives the error about finding the server.

Enough spoonfeeding for today, thank you for your help (again)

Read full topic

@ziplock wrote:

Well you could try:

#!/bin/bash
javac -cp . *.java

If that doesn’t work then I recommend just creating a Hello World program on your Desktop and seeing if it will compile using the terminal.

cd Desktop
javac *.java

item.dc:creator: @youridudock youridudock
item.description:
@youridudock wrote:

[quote=“ziplock, post:18, topic:478559”]Well that’s odd, it works fine for me.

What is the output when you type in “javac -version”

Also, if you play around with Ubuntu and other Linux Distro’s, then you will eventually get the hang of it. I’m not a seasoned user by any means either, so don’t worry. I’ve just been playing around with different Distro’s for a year or so now.[/quote]

The version is: 1.7.0_09

Some strange shit going on :p, maybe I fucked up when adding shit to envoriments…

Read full topic

item.title: Linux Ubuntu VPS - Alot of problems
item.dc:creator: @youridudock youridudock
item.description:
@youridudock wrote:

Haha yeah ofcourse I have all the .class files, the last thing I am going to try is to compile.

Came back with:

javac: invailed flag: *.java
: not found 3:
: not found 4:
: not found 5:

Sorry that I know close to nothing about Linux, feeling right a real newbie now

Read full topic
item.source: Linux Ubuntu VPS - Alot of problems

item.title: Linux Ubuntu VPS - Alot of problems
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

[quote=“youridudock, post:15, topic:478559”][quote author=ziplock link=topic=596786.msg4202302#msg4202302 date=1358385079]
I’m not completely sure on the backwards compatibly, I just use Java7 for everything.

No problem, I hope you find a solution. :]
[/quote]

One last question,

Would you know how to make this work for linux?

@echo off
if exist “%programfiles%\Java” (call :compile “%programfiles%\Java”) else (goto error)
:compile
for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe")
if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java)
if defined p (goto end)
:error
echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load.
:end
echo Finished!
pause
exit

It looks for program files :/[/quote]

Well the great thing about Linux is that this is not needed.

All you should have to do is create a script like the one below and run it in the directory with your source files.

#!/bin/bash
javac *.java

This is just a generic execution of the Java Compiler, the “*.java” tell’s the compiler to compile all files ending with the extension “.java”.

Edit:
Also, yes, you are required to compile on the VPS as well, if you just have the source files.

Read full topic

item.title: Linux Ubuntu VPS - Alot of problems
item.dc:creator: @youridudock youridudock
item.description:
@youridudock wrote:

[quote=“ziplock, post:14, topic:478559”]I’m not completely sure on the backwards compatibly, I just use Java7 for everything.

No problem, I hope you find a solution. :][/quote]

One last question,

Would you know how to make this work for linux?

@echo off
if exist “%programfiles%\Java” (call :compile “%programfiles%\Java”) else (goto error)
:compile
for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe")
if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java)
if defined p (goto end)
:error
echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load.
:end
echo Finished!
pause
exit

It looks for program files

item.title: Linux Ubuntu VPS - Alot of problems
item.dc:creator: @youridudock youridudock
item.description:
@youridudock wrote:

ziplock:

You’ve compiled the source and everything? If it’s in the same location as your server class then I’m not sure what else could be the problem. The error is saying that it cannot find your “server.class”.

Mhh strange, I recalling when you compile with a newer version of Java and you try to run the server with a older Java a error could happen.

Not sure if this is the case… I will try to find out why.

Thanks for all the help, you really helped me alot.
rep++ xD

  • Youri

EDIT: I did not compile on the Vps. Do I have to do that?

Read full topic

@ziplock wrote:

[quote=“youridudock, post:9, topic:478559”]Nice. That was one step.

Now it is saying; Could not find or load main class server

Thanks for your help so far.[/quote]

The semi-colon’s were throwing it off. Is your script in a location where it can access your server class?

item.title: Linux Ubuntu VPS - Alot of problems
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

Yes, you should be executing the shell script (run.sh) through the terminal.

Try this script

#!/bin/bash
java -Xmx500m -cp ".;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.08-ga-bin.jar" server

Read full topic
item.source: Linux Ubuntu VPS - Alot of problems

item.title: Linux Ubuntu VPS - Alot of problems
item.dc:creator: @youridudock youridudock
item.description:
@youridudock wrote:

root@removed:~/server/map# sh run.sh Usage: java [-options] class [args...] (to execute a class) or java [-options] -jar jarfile [args...] (to execute a jar file) where options include: -d32 use a 32-bit data model if available -d64 use a 64-bit data model if available -client to select the "client" VM -server to select the "server" VM -zero to select the "zero" VM -jamvm to select the "jamvm" VM -avian to select the "avian" VM -hotspot is a synonym for the "client" VM [deprecated] The default VM is server, because you are running on a server-class machine. 
-cp <class search path of directories and zip/jar files>
-classpath <class search path of directories and zip/jar files>
              A : separated list of directories, JAR archives,
              and ZIP archives to search for class files.
-D<name>=<value>
              set a system property
-verbose[:class|gc|jni]
              enable verbose output
-version      print product version and exit
-version:<value>
              require the specified version to run
-showversion  print product version and continue
-jre-restrict-search | -no-jre-restrict-search
              include/exclude user private JREs in the version search
-? -help      print this help message
-X            print help on non-standard options
-ea[:<packagename>...|:<classname>]
-enableassertions[:<packagename>...|:<classname>]
              enable assertions with specified granularity
-da[:<packagename>...|:<classname>]
-disableassertions[:<packagename>...|:<classname>]
              disable assertions with specified granularity
-esa | -enablesystemassertions
              enable system assertions
-dsa | -disablesystemassertions
              disable system assertions
-agentlib:<libname>[=<options>]
              load native agent library <libname>, e.g. -agentlib:hprof
              see also, -agentlib:jdwp=help and -agentlib:hprof=help
-agentpath:<pathname>[=<options>]
              load native agent library by full pathname
-javaagent:<jarpath>[=<options>]
              load Java programming language agent, see java.lang.instrument
-splash:<imagepath>
              show splash screen with specified image

See http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/documentation/index.html for more details.

Thats when I get when I ran it in the terminal.
(Not sure if I should run this in the terminal?)

Anyways if you mean I should add this somehow to the application I set it to executeable already.

Read full topic
item.source: Linux Ubuntu VPS - Alot of problems

item.title: Linux Ubuntu VPS - Alot of problems
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

[quote=“youridudock, post:5, topic:478559”][quote author=ziplock link=topic=596786.msg4202235#msg4202235 date=1358378592]

#!/bin/bash
java -Xmx500m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.08-ga-bin.jar server

Name it “run.sh”

Done that, did not work

I am just going to ask for a refund, I dont really like Ubuntu…

Did you use “sh run.sh”?

Also, do you get any error messages, or any feedback at all?
[/quote]

I used the code you gave, the file is named: run.sh
I ran it and nothing happends.

I think there is something wrong with my envoriment shit but it is very confusing.
I tried what Fat Cookies said in his tutorial but it is not working (Is also from 2009).

I found alot of tutorials but they are ALL old and some dont even include envoriment? So I dont really know.[/quote]

Well when you install Java it should automatically set the alternatives.

Try typing “java -version” in the console to see if you have it installed correctly.

Also, “sh run.sh” is the command you should use to execute the script.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @youridudock youridudock
item.description:
@youridudock wrote:

Hello,

I have a problem with my Linux Ubuntu VPS, when ever I type the run command for my .sh my server does not go online.
I also cant check if it is running! Because I am on putty.

Anyone that can help?

To what should my run.bat change?

code:


@echo off
java -Xmx500m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.08-ga-bin.jar server
pause

Thanks

Read full topic
